revised_title: Ionization Mechanisms and Kinetics of Alkaline Earth Additives in Hydrogen Flames
tldr: This study investigates the ionization and recombination processes of alkaline earth additives in hydrogen flames. The authors found that ionization levels do not correspond to an equilibrium state, and they measured the rates of ion production and disappearance. They concluded that a third-order scheme is the most feasible ionization mechanism and that recombination occurs through a dissociative process. The findings provide insights into the behavior of alkaline earth species in flames and their potential applications in various fields.
